settings.text:
• Property Type: Luxury multi-family residential community 
  • Property Size: 284,000 sq. ft. residential property, 241 units
  • Services Provided: Commissioning and installation of original artwork, prints, wallcoverings, and custom fabricated metal panels; curation of a cohesive art program celebrating Cleveland’s architecture; design integration into public corridors and high-traffic amenity areas

• A city-wide placemaking approach engaged ArtLifting artists to reflect Cleveland’s identity through diverse mediums making the property a deeply rooted and visually compelling place to live.
  • Allen Chamberland’s papercut silhouettes of Cleveland landmarks were transformed into custom laser-cut metal artworks, offering a striking visual connection to local architecture while elevating the building’s lobby and public spaces.
  • ArtLifting’s collaboration with Stoneleigh Companies connected luxury design with social impact by showcasing the work of artists with disabilities, reinforcing the Waterford brand’s values of community, authenticity, and local connection.

settings.heading: Creating a sense of place for a multifamily development

settings.text:
For Stoneleigh Companies, which operates over 40,000 multifamily
units in 35 cities, it's important to connect their residents with local environments. The Waterford Residential brand requires a unique touch for every location.


At the 284,000-square-foot Waterford Bluffs property in Cleveland, ArtLifting drew on a number of art placement strategies to draw connections between residents, the building, and the city. The property features the work of 18 ArtLifting artists.


Authentically contributing to placemaking at the residences, Stoneleigh Companies commissioned ArtLifting artists to create original works celebrating the architecture of downtown Cleveland.


2-D papercut artworks by Allen Chamberland of Cleveland landmarks bring the city into the space as largescale wallcoverings and unique metal reproductions. Allen and the ArtLifting team transformed his artworks depicting the Rock and Roll Hall of Fame and the Cleveland Trust Building into laser cut metal panels. The silhouettes were mounted on brushed steel to create a dramatic sky effect.


About the commission, Allen shares, “I am always looking for inspiration, and I’m really excited about how these two pieces look completed. I feel like I’ve really grown as an artist, and working with clients such as Stoneleigh Companies has really helped to push and challenge myself.”


The works also appear in a long hallway with street visibility, taking residents and passersby alike on a tour of their city's architecture.


An original painting by Shana Stern titled Oh I Wept hangs in the elevator bay at Waterford Bluffs. The painting was created only with the artist’s fingers and hands to apply paint, providing a bespoke element to the sleek interior.


Prints throughout Waterford Bluffs, including a cityscape of Cleveland by Michaels Lyric, further placemaking efforts at every opportunity. The comprehensive approach with attention to high impact installations in key areas elevate the modern design and engage residents with meaningful and locally-inspired artwork.

"ArtLifting is the best way to get quality original artwork anywhere and give back to the artistic community in so many ways. It was affordable, philanthropic and rewarding on all fronts.
Our hearts and our residents have been ArtLifted."


- Rick Cavenaugh, President, Stoneleigh Companies, LLC

“Being able to work with companies like Stoneleigh has allowed me to become financially independent and not have to rely on disability [income].”


-Allen Chamberland, ArtLifting artist

Images

  1. Commissioned 2-D papercut artworks by Allen Chamberland were transformed into metal for the Waterford Bluffs visitor entrance.
  2. A series of black and white wallcoverings feature silhouettes by Allen Chamberland.
  3. A cityscape by Michaels Lyric hangs on a wall near a bar in kitchen area.
  4. A painting by Shana Stern hangs in an elevator bay.
  5. A series of black and white wallcoverings feature silhouettes by Allen Chamberland.
